data: "Blocks are like containers that store transaction data. When you match blocks, you’re adding new transactions to the blockchain!"
"Your blocks form a chain, just like the blockchain, where each block is linked to the previous one, creating a secure, unbreakable record!"
"The faster the blocks move, the more congested the network becomes. High activity means it’s harder and more costly to process transactions!"
"Blockchains rely on consensus, where the network agrees on which transactions are valid. In your game, aligning blocks correctly ensures your chain keeps growing!"
"On real blockchains, transactions cost gas fees. In your game, faster speeds are like higher fees—things get tougher as demand rises!"
"Smart contracts are self-executing agreements on the blockchain. They make things happen automatically, like wildcard blocks that can align with anything!"
"Sometimes, blockchains can split into different paths, called forks. Keep aligning blocks correctly to avoid splits and keep your chain strong!"
"Nodes are computers that keep the blockchain running by validating transactions. The more aligned blocks you have, the stronger your blockchain’s network becomes!"
"If over half the network controls the chain, it could rewrite transactions. Keep aligning blocks to keep your chain secure!"
"Proof of Work requires solving puzzles (like aligning blocks) to validate transactions. Proof of Stake would slow things down, making block placement strategic!"
"Blockchains can struggle to handle lots of transactions at once. Keep building efficiently to avoid a traffic jam in your chain!"
"dApps are applications built on blockchain technology, using smart contracts to run without central control. Special blocks in your game simulate how dApps can add unique functions to the chain!"
